intro: Lepidium seravschanicum, commonly known as the Serafschan cress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its small, erect growth habit and features basal leaves that are typically lobed or toothed. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which are typical of the mustard family. Its seeds are enclosed in siliques, which are long, slender pods that split open to release the seeds. Lepidium seravschanicum is native to Central Asia and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions.
